intro: Tarenna lancilimba, commonly known as the slender tarenna, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, elliptical seeds. Tarenna lancilimba is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
